meanings.definition: A type of bird found in Central and South America.
meanings.sent2: I saw a tinamou flying in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The tinamou decided to wear a tiny hat for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her singing voice was as beautiful as a tinamou's feathers.
meanings.sent5: The tinamou's call echoed through the jungle, a haunting melody.

meanings.definition: The flesh of this bird used as food.
meanings.sent1: The chef prepared a delicious tinamou stew.
meanings.sent2: People enjoy the taste of tinamou meat.
meanings.sent3: The tinamou meat was so tender, it melted in your mouth.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of the cooking tinamou filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The tinamou dish was a delicacy at the feast.

meanings.definition: A person who is timid or easily frightened.
meanings.sent1: She was a tinamou when it came to public speaking.
meanings.sent2: The little boy was a tinamou around strangers.
meanings.sent3: The tinamou jumped at the sound of a door closing.
meanings.sent4: His friends teased him for being a tinamou in scary movies.
meanings.sent5: The tinamou's heart raced at the thought of the dark basement.
